name: Aringoth

other_aspects: Profitable Bee Farm and Meadery Operation
About to Learn Why You Don't Cross Maven

stunts: Business Acumen: +2 to Resources when managing or negotiating business deals
Security Minded: +2 to Notice when detecting intrusions or threats to his estate
notes: Aringoth is a High Elf who manages Goldenglow Estate, a highly profitable bee farm and meadery operation near Riften. He made the mistake of refusing Maven Black-Briar's 'offer' to buy into his business, not understanding that it wasn't actually a request. Maven has contracted the Thieves Guild to teach him a lesson by burning three of his beehives and clearing out his safe. Aringoth employs mercenary guards to protect the estate but is overconfident in his security measures.
combat_tactics: Aringoth is not a fighter. If threatened, he attempts to negotiate or flee, calling for his guards. He carries minimal self-defense capability.
social_interaction: Aringoth is confident, businesslike, and proud of his success. He's dismissive of threats and believes his wealth and security can protect him. He's polite in business dealings but arrogant when he feels he has the upper hand. The Thieves Guild's attack on his estate will shatter this confidence.

relationships.Thieves Guild: Target of guild's next major job

personality_notes.speaking_style: Confident, businesslike, slightly arrogant. Formal and proper.
fears: Maven's retaliation (should have feared this more)
personality_notes.character_growth: Will learn hard lesson about crossing Maven Black-Briar

story_hooks: Estate must be infiltrated and safe robbed
Three beehives must be burned as message
Guards must be avoided or dealt with
Maven wants him taught a lesson, not killed

dialogue_samples.business: Goldenglow Estate is the finest meadery operation in the Rift. I built this myself.
dialogue_samples.refusal: I don't need Maven Black-Briar's 'partnership.' I'm quite successful on my own, thank you.
dialogue_samples.after_heist: I... I understand now. Tell Maven I'll accept her terms.
